action.action-desc: Mrs. Chavez-DeRemer introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To prohibit authority to provide financial assistance for, or approve, tolling on Interstate Route 5 or Interstate Route 205 in the State of Oregon under certain tolling programs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Tolls on Oregon Roads Act of 2023.

section.header: Prohibition on use of funds for tolling on Interstate Route 5 or Interstate Route 205

subsection.text: Section 129(d)(6) of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall not allow the use of tolls on Interstate Route 5 or Interstate Route 205 in the State of Oregon as part of a project carried out with a grant under the program.

subsection.header: Toll roads, bridges, tunnels, and ferries
subsection.text: Section 129 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on tolling on certain Interstates
subsection.text: Notwithstanding this section or any other provision of law, the Secretary may not approve Federal participation in the tolling of Interstate Route 5 or Interstate Route 205 in the State of Oregon.

Section 1012(b)(4) of the Intermodal Surface Transportation Efficiency Act of 1991 (23 U.S.C. 129 note(b)) is amended by inserting , except that the Secretary shall not allow tolling of Interstate Route 5 or Interstate Route 205 in the State of Oregon before the period at the end.
